Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body and neck of a red-brown pottery storage-vessel with ribbed neck, the fabric is light-brown in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of one line of Greek text written in black ink. EA66305 belongs to this fragments.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393820) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393820)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (fig.27)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Gr. 1 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
